title: Trump Announces Strike Against ISIS in Nigeria
summary: The attack comes after President Trump ordered the Defense Department last month to prepare to intervene militarily in Nigeria to protect Christians from Islamic militants.

title: Trump Says ‘Housing First’ Failed the Homeless. Here’s What the Evidence Says.
summary: The Trump administration has sought to move away from the model, which supporters call “evidence based” but opponents consider overly permissive.

title: Kennedy Center’s Christmas Eve Jazz Show Canceled After Trump Name Added to Building
summary: Chuck Redd, a jazz musician, said he canceled his annual concert after President Trump’s name was affixed to the Washington building’s facade.

title: Trump Has a New Auto Loan Tax Break. Here’s Who Could Benefit.
summary: Many Americans can take advantage of President Trump’s deduction on auto loan interest, but the tax break will provide only modest savings.

title: Judge Blocks Detention of British Researcher Who Scrutinizes Online Hate
summary: Imran Ahmed, who runs an organization that chronicles disinformation, was among five Europeans the State Department had barred, claiming they promote censorship.

title: More Rain Headed to California After Christmas Flooding and Power Outages
summary: Officials warned that driving would remain hazardous across much of the state, with heavy rain still to fall in some places that broke records on Christmas Eve.

title: New York City Braces for Heavy Snow as Winter Storm Approaches
summary: The region could see accumulations of up to 5 to 7 inches from late Friday into Saturday.

title: No Power, No Heat, No Water: Odesa’s Days of Hell Under Russian Fire
summary: The toll on older people and those with disabilities is especially severe as Moscow’s forces repeatedly attack the port city’s infrastructure.

title: Why Russia Is Likely to Reject the New US-Ukrainian Peace Plan
summary: The first draft essentially called for Ukraine’s surrender. The revised version includes the security guarantees Kyiv wants to prevent future Russian aggression.

title: That Old Classic Film in the Theater? It Might Be From This Man’s House.
summary: The artifacts of 20th-century cinema are being preserved in museums, and in the care of private film collectors like Brian Darwas, who has hundreds of movie prints at his home.

title: Prominent Leaders Amplify Disinformation About Brown University Shooting
summary: Prominent business and government figures spread rumors about the attack on Brown University’s campus this month, reigniting questions about accountability in online discourse.

title: A Man Who Shunned Cheap Sentiment Left a Gift for Others: Life
summary: Brendan Costello was a cleareyed writer who might have found this article a bit treacly. Such is the cost of being a good guy.

title: His Death Was Interrupted, Just as He Had Planned
summary: Brendan Costello’s family was bracing for goodbyes. But he had one last wish.

title: With Trump in Power, Democrats Try to Redefine Themselves as Disrupters
summary: Since President Trump’s rise, Democrats have served as defenders of a political system many Americans believe is broken. Now the party is trying a new approach.

title: Estonia’s Man on Capitol Hill Is on a Charm Offensive
summary: The Baltic nation’s congressional liaison is using candy, an American flag outfit and “Die Hard” jokes to make friends in Congress as the Trump administration turns against Europe.

title: The Class Where ‘Screenagers’ Train to Navigate Social Media and A.I.
summary: New technologies are complicating efforts to teach the scrolling generation to think critically and defensively online.

title: They Were Supposed to Protect Young Workers. Instead, They Cashed In.
summary: Profit-seekers co-opted America’s premier cultural exchange program, the J-1 visa, which brought young people to work in the United States. Some sponsors charged thousands in fees.

title: Pope Leo Makes Christmas Call for Dialogue to Address World’s Conflicts
summary: Leo XIV’s Christmas address was his first since being elected pontiff and was scrutinized for comparisons with those of his predecessor, Francis.

title: King Charles Urges ‘Compassion’ and Finding Strength in Diversity in Annual Christmas Message
summary: His annual Christmas message was more outward-looking than last year’s, when he focused on the medical workers who had helped him and his daughter-in-law after their cancer diagnoses.

title: Christmas Around the World in Photos
summary: The holiday spirit is bringing people together, with celebrations of lights, dance and Santa.

title: Why the Right Is Boycotting Havaianas Flip-Flops
summary: For decades, Havaianas flip-flops have been a beloved global symbol of Brazilian culture, worn by millions of people each day. They are now ensnared in a political fight.

title: Let Your Phone Go Gray
summary: Julia Angwin turns her iPhone screen to gray and learns a lot about her relationship with her phone.

title: I’ve Been the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees for a Decade. This Is the Crisis I See.
summary: Populist rhetoric is numbing us to the plight of others.

title: Kimmel Tells U.K. Viewers ‘Tyranny Is Booming’ in America
summary: Chosen by a British TV station to give an “alternative” to the king’s speech, Jimmy Kimmel said it had been a great year for the U.S. “from a fascism perspective.”

title: $1.817 Billion Powerball Jackpot Won by Single Ticket in Arkansas
summary: A single ticket drawn Wednesday night won the second-largest U.S. lottery jackpot ever.

title: Tesla Robotaxis Are Big on Wall St. but Lagging on Roads
summary: Shares of Tesla have hit new highs on optimism about the company’s self-driving taxis. But experts say Tesla is far behind Waymo, which has a big head start.

title: Robert Lindsey, Times Reporter and Reagan Ghostwriter, Dies at 90
summary: The nonfiction spy thriller “The Falcon and the Snowman,” which became a film, grew out of his work as a journalist covering the West Coast for The Times.
